intro: Uragoga didymocarpos, commonly known as the two-seeded uragoga, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release two seeds. Uragoga didymocarpos is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
